Description: An Atlanta-based building products distributor agreed to pay $265,000 to settling allegations that it violated securities laws by using severance agreements that required outgoing employees to waive their rights to monetary recovery should they file a charge or complaint with the SEC or other federal agencies.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/news/pressrelease/2016-157.html
https://www.fra.dot.gov/eLib/details/L04899#p1_z5_gD_lEA

Description: The United States settled a whistleblower lawsuit against DynCorp International LLC and its subcontractor The Sandi Group alleging that they submitted or caused to be submitted false claims for payment under DynCorp's contract with the Department of State to provide civilian police training in Iraq.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/dyncorp-international-llc-and-sandi-group-pay-us-more-87-million-resolve-false-claims

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 81131: Commercial and Industrial Machinery and Equipment (except Automotive and Electronic) Repair and Main
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: To settle a case involving groundwater contamination, the agreed to pay $1 million to the New Mexico Natural Resources Trustee for natural resource damages; a $293,500 penalty to the United States for violating a 1998 cleanup order; $181,500 in civil penalties that will go to the State of New Mexico; and $200,000 in litigation costs to the State of New Mexico and the City of Albuquerque.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2000/January/030enrd.htm

Description: BAWAG P.S.K., formally known  as  Bank  Fur  Arbeit  Und  Wirtschaft  Und  Osterreichische Postparkasse  Aktiengesellschaft,  and  the  Austrian  Trade  Unions Association, formally known as Osterreichischer Gewerkschaftsbund (OGB), which owns BAWAG, agreed to forfeit $337.5 million to victims of the  fraud  at  Refco,  Inc.,  as  part  of  an  agreement  that  the Government will not prosecute BAWAG or the OGB.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Southern District of New York
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/usao/nys/pressreleases/June06/bagwagnon-prosecutionagreementpr.pdf
Sparton Pays State $1 Million, Albuquerque Journal, May 24, 2000 (via Nexis).

Description: Remington Arms agreed to pay $73 million to settle a lawsuit brought by families of the victims of the 2012 Sandy Hook shootings alleging that the company had marketed the AR-15 weapon used in the massacre to violence-prone men.
Court: Superior Court of Connecticut, Complex Litigation Docket, Judicial District of Waterbury
Private Litigation Case Title: Donna Soto et al. v. Bushmaster Firearms International LLC et al.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1465327/remington-settles-with-sandy-hook-families-for-73m
